column4: Hello? I'm getting ready to move my Wubi install to its own partition. I've been deleting stuff from my 134GB data partition in preparation. It has 28% of its space free now, and I've defragmented it several times. But I can't get data to move away from the end of the partition. Is it safe to resize the partition anyway?
maybe you could defrag...whats the filesystem type fat16 or fat32?
I've been defragging several times. It's a fat32 filesystem, and I've been using AusLogics Disk Defrag.
hmm...do you have a backup on another partition
No, unfortunately. I have a laptop with a 160GB hard drive.
I gave 15GB to Windows XP and 134GB to other data.
the wubi thing is how big exactly...never used it myself so do not know
my Wubi install is 8GB. It's split across 3 disks: a swap one that's just under 1GB, and two others that are under 4 and 3GB.
they're virtual disks, by the way
cant think of any straighforward way for you...guess its easiest to just use partition magic..that should minimize the risk involved
I have the GParted LiveCD. Is that better or worse than Partition Magic?
still dont understand why you want wubi...why not do a simple fresh install
I want to keep the stuff I've done to it. Like wireless drivers. They were a pain in the butt to set up.
and besides, even if I did a fresh install, I'd face the same partitioning problems.
